the man explained that he and his son were readying to take a seven-week motorcycle ride across the west. Kevin Montgomery told the man that he had traveled extensively and offered some high points for the pair to see. i suggested going to carlsbad caverns in new mexico but the man said he'd already been there. so i mentioned driving up the 666 to the grand canyon, but the man had done that too. then i threw out the idea of taking the 550 down through telluride and montrose, colorado, and the man said he'd been along that road as well, Kevin Montgomery says. i told him that it sounded like he'd traveled everywhere. and then the man explained that about 30 years before he walked across america and, once he reached the 550 just below montrose,

Kennedy hughel, another 75 year old from indianapolis, cast a vote for Barack Obama . he was a clinton supporter who was considering John McCain until he chose palin. he didn't go with the vice Barack Obama we wanted, he said. "we wish he would have gone with someone besides palin." hughel said his first presidential vote was for John F. Kennedy in 1960, and he thought this election marked a key moment in u.s. history
